net.greghaines.jesque.worker

Class WorkerImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.greghaines.jesque.worker.WorkerImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Runnable, JobExecutor, Worker

    public class WorkerImpl
extends Object
implements Worker
    WorkerImpl is an implementation of the Worker interface. Obeys the contract of a Resque worker in Redis.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface net.greghaines.jesque.worker.JobExecutor

        JobExecutor.State

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      WorkerImpl(Config config, Collection<String> queues, JobFactory jobFactory)
      Creates a new WorkerImpl, which creates it's own connection to Redis using values from the config.
      The worker will only listen to the supplied queues and execute jobs that are provided by the given job factory.
      WorkerImpl(Config config, Collection<String> queues, JobFactory jobFactory, redis.clients.jedis.Jedis jedis)
      Creates a new WorkerImpl, with the given connection to Redis.
      The worker will only listen to the supplied queues and execute jobs that are provided by the given job factory.
      WorkerImpl(Config config, Collection<String> queues, JobFactory jobFactory, redis.clients.jedis.Jedis jedis, NextQueueStrategy nextQueueStrategy)
      Creates a new WorkerImpl, with the given connection to Redis.
      The worker will only listen to the supplied queues and execute jobs that are provided by the given job factory.

    • Constructor Detail

      • WorkerImpl

        public WorkerImpl(Config config,
                  Collection<String> queues,
                  JobFactory jobFactory)
        Creates a new WorkerImpl, which creates it's own connection to Redis using values from the config.
        The worker will only listen to the supplied queues and execute jobs that are provided by the given job factory.
        Parameters:
        config - used to create a connection to Redis and the package prefix for incoming jobs
        queues - the list of queues to poll
        jobFactory - the job factory that materializes the jobs
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either config, queues or jobFactory is null

      • WorkerImpl

        public WorkerImpl(Config config,
                  Collection<String> queues,
                  JobFactory jobFactory,
                  redis.clients.jedis.Jedis jedis)
        Creates a new WorkerImpl, with the given connection to Redis.
        The worker will only listen to the supplied queues and execute jobs that are provided by the given job factory. Uses the DRAIN_WHILE_MESSAGES_EXISTS NextQueueStrategy.
        Parameters:
        config - used to create a connection to Redis and the package prefix for incoming jobs
        queues - the list of queues to poll
        jobFactory - the job factory that materializes the jobs
        jedis - the connection to Redis
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either config, queues, jobFactory or jedis is null

      • WorkerImpl

        public WorkerImpl(Config config,
                  Collection<String> queues,
                  JobFactory jobFactory,
                  redis.clients.jedis.Jedis jedis,
                  NextQueueStrategy nextQueueStrategy)
        Creates a new WorkerImpl, with the given connection to Redis.
        The worker will only listen to the supplied queues and execute jobs that are provided by the given job factory.
        Parameters:
        config - used to create a connection to Redis and the package prefix for incoming jobs
        queues - the list of queues to poll
        jobFactory - the job factory that materializes the jobs
        jedis - the connection to Redis
        nextQueueStrategy - defines worker behavior once it has found messages in a queue
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either config, queues, jobFactory, jedis or nextQueueStrategy is null

    • Method Detail

      • isThreadNameChangingEnabled

        public static boolean isThreadNameChangingEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if worker threads names will change during normal operation

      • setThreadNameChangingEnabled

        public static void setThreadNameChangingEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enable/disable worker thread renaming during normal operation. (Disabled by default)

        Warning: Enabling this feature is very expensive CPU-wise!
        This feature is designed to assist in debugging worker state but should be disabled in production environments for performance reasons.

        Parameters:
        enabled - whether threads' names should change during normal operation

      • checkQueues

        protected static void checkQueues(Iterable<String> queues)
        Verify that the given queues are all valid.
        Parameters:
        queues - the given queues

      • getWorkerId

        public long getWorkerId()
        Returns:
        this worker's identifier

      • run

        public void run()
        Starts this worker. Registers the worker in Redis and begins polling the queues for jobs.
        Stop this worker by calling end() on any thread.
        Specified by:
        run in interface Runnable

      • end

        public void end(boolean now)
        Shutdown this Worker.
        The worker cannot be started again; create a new worker in this case.
        Specified by:
        end in interface JobExecutor
        Parameters:
        now - if true, an effort will be made to stop any job in progress

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Returns whether this worker is paused.
        Specified by:
        isPaused in interface Worker
        Returns:
        whether this worker is paused. If true, the worker is not processing any new jobs; if false, the worker is processing new jobs

        Parameters:

      • addQueue

        public void addQueue(String queueName)
        Poll the given queue. If the queue exists multiple times, it will be checked that many times per loop. This allows for a queue to be given higher priority by checking it more often.
        Specified by:
        addQueue in interface Worker
        Parameters:
        queueName - the name of the queue to poll

      • removeQueue

        public void removeQueue(String queueName,
                        boolean all)
        Stop polling the given queue. If the all argument is true, all instances of the queue will be removed, otherwise, only one instance is removed.
        Specified by:
        removeQueue in interface Worker
        Parameters:
        queueName - the queue to stop polling
        all - whether to remove all or only one of the instances

      • join

        public void join(long millis)
          throws InterruptedException
        Wait for this JobExecutor to complete. A timeout of 0 means to wait forever. This method will only return after a thread has called JobExecutor.end(boolean).
        Specified by:
        join in interface JobExecutor
        Parameters:
        millis - the time to wait in milliseconds
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if any thread has interrupted the current thread
